pros: Colleagues good. Tight team and good line management
cons: Small, so time off has to be coordinated

pros: Walking distance into town at lunchtime
cons: Promotions of 'friends' rather than skilled professionals puts everyone at risk in many ways. Unsupported staff, poor decisions, not utilizing the strengths of others, just egos that are far too big. They don't listen to concerns and when you seek support/advice you are told to 'just get on with it', highlighting the lack of education/experience/leadership of the decision makers. Scary stuff when working at a college who have responsibility for the welfare of 1000's of students!!

pros: Generous annual leave allowance is all I can think of.
cons:
Pay 
Top heavy management structure 
Emphasis on commercial businesses that don’t make a profit, over education of students 
Awful IT and no help on implementing of new systems 
No cohesion between departments

pros: Close to the town centre so you can get away at lunch times.
cons: Cronyism at its worst. Unprofessional working practices.

review_title: Conditions and pay and management unacceptable!
pros: Students can be a pro, this is a big but. Other lecturing staff whom are still there. The city. Free parking if you can get it.
cons: Where do I start? Pay is a massive issue amongst the 10’s each month that are fleeing and not being replaced such as I. Our department is being decimated by bad decisions and directors that couldn’t direct a play let along a multi faceted departmental structure. Working conditions are barely acceptable with an IT system that either doesn’t work or is so out of date and a support facility that seriously do not know what they are doing. Students that are rude and aggressive seems to be the way these days in construction, care and the like. A safeguarding system that doesn’t work or that isn’t available, with numerous instances of m/h support being unavailable for those that need it. Parking is a joke after 8am, leaving you out of pocket again paying for multi-storey parking. A management structure that keeps getting bigger and wider depending on “if your face fits and you kiss the right frog”, this makes the staff realise that the 1% last year and I hear just announced 2.5% pay uplift for lecturing staff is affected by the inefficiencies caused by these extra layers of middle nonsense. The CPD structure again is forced on days of ineffective waffle where lecturers feel and openly question the validity. As for me, I’m out, off to self employment where the management are great and the opportunities for private work is far greater.

pros: Dedicated, frontline, staff who work far more than their contract to ensure students acheive
cons: Crippling workload, very load pay, managers don't listen

review_title: A college trying to do its best for the learners
pros:
Good focus on learning in the classroom.
Staff are focused on the quality of what they do.
Gym and Spa are good
Tries its best to raise money from other sources by being part of lincoln college group.
cons:
Parking can be a problem 
Suffers from the same issues as other colleges due to funding restrictions

pros: Staff are great. Knowledgeable, supportive and friendly.
cons: Workload tends to be high. The majority of marking and lesson planning ends up being done in your own time.

pros: Good staff and lovely students
cons: Management do not have any idea what it is like to work here. They do not wish to change and improve conditions only to appear to do so, coffee mornings put on to reduce stress without tackling the causes of that stress. IT that does not work effectively. Managers who have no management experience or training

pros: Good work life balance at the business
cons: Parking is difficult. Salaries are lagging behind other sectors

review_title: I've been with them for about a year, so I don't really have a deeper insight
pros: The people seem to be nice and friendly.
cons: My experience so far has been positive, thank heaven

review_title: Best education institute I've worked at
pros: Really supportive and understanding staff from across the board
cons: I regret leaving, as I am now at a worse F. E. providor

review_title: Good staff | Good students | Not so good management - needs improvements
pros:
The teaching staff are well qualified and really dedicated, that is crucial
Most (not all) student want to improve and show genuine concern
The library has all required resources
cons:
The management is next to unapproachable - for everyone - students and staff alike.
The management has mind of it own
It takes absolutely no suggestions or input from staff or students
All! Staff and students are critical of the management, I've not met one who is not.
The management has no idea what to do to improve for Ofsted and are more or using pressure tactics on teachers.

pros:
Holidays are generous
Facilities are good in most areas
Most staff work hard to support students as best they can
cons:
Management don’t care about staff or students. Far to strategically focused and business orientation. Lost focus on people and their needs. 
Management aren’t in touch with staff and are extremely cut throat.

pros: Close to the city centre for the junk food you’ll need to get through the day.
cons:
No parking unless you’re willing to get in at the crack of dawn
Management have no clue what they are doing. The majority of them have been promoted because they’ve sucked up
Too many rounds of redundancy but the CEO and MDs refuse to take a pay cut to save the staff they ‘value’ 
No budget for staff development so training is rarely given meaning staff rarely achieve their full potential 
Too many unrealistic objectives and an ever shifting focus means that no one ever knows what’s going on 
Ventures in to the commercial industry are taking presidence over the primary operation - education!
Poor facilities and equipment for staff and students - but a suite for the CEO

pros:
The staff and students.  
I love this job!  I know this is not a fashionable thing to say, but I really do!  I love getting up in front of a class and being paid to talk about my favourite subject, one I am passionate about.  I love being able to share that passion and see my students pick up on it, see the light switch on as they ‘get it’ and begin to enter my world and my interests.

What we do is a privilege, and our students are amazing.  Often they come from challenging backgrounds, have a host of issues that other would describe as ‘barriers to education’.  However, our students are taught that they just as are entitled to their education as those who are going to fee paying schools or those with the perfect GCSE scores or no statemented needs.  It is the teaching and support staff that instil this into our students, this drive to succeed, this idea that they can achieve despite all odds.  Our teaching staff won’t take any excuses, we don’t worry about dyslexia (It didn’t hold me back!) or homelessness – we will get help you get an education.

What is so great about working here – the determination of the staff and students to work together to achieve this, despite the odds.
cons:
Over the many years I have worked at Lincoln College I have seen it go from an average FE college to an Outstanding College to a money making venture.  The last being the worst case scenario.  No pay rise in 8 years (not even in line with inflation) and constantly accused of underperforming.  My workload has increased massively over the last 8 years.
The recent poor OFSTED report was more than fair in its heavy criticism of the management team.  I hope they will listen and make efforts to change.  Although I am not confident that this will be the case.  
I love my department, my colleagues, but I hate what management is doing to my lovely workplace.

pros: Freedom to produce own handouts and assignmens with 21 hrs teaching contact a week. A friendly environment to work in. Engineering department are pro CPD.
cons: The senior management team are awfully detached from operations on the ground. They sometimes fail to appreciate the different workloads for lecturers teaching at different levels and that you are paid the same whether you teach entry level 3 (pre GCSE) or level 5 (HE).

pros: Love the teaching topics and student/employer interaction. IT systems good. Supportive colleagues.
cons: Teaching staff have little impact on management. Executive team isolated from teachers and orders come down on stone tablets. Sports staff have too much influence. Workload high and stressful at times.

pros:
As a department, we all worked together to help learners achieve.

Management were very supportive and saw things from a developmental point of view.

Given the challenges F.E. in general faces, my department remained calm and understanding despite all of the pressure.
cons: Unpredictable - But that's just the Further Education sector in general

pros: Nice place, students and staff
cons: Very telling that the only positives about management here are written by managers!

pros: very structured, by the book, flexible working
